skillTree.localised_description: The Dragon Prince’s unwavering steed is bedecked in plates and scales of ‘sky-silver’ that mimic the appearance of a mighty Drake.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

skillTree.localised_description: Imrik’s fanatically loyal Drake is a symbol of the Elf Lord’s irrefutable eminence as the last true Dragon Prince.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

skillTree.localised_description: The High Elves possess a natural skill that far outstrips the prowess of ordinary mortals.
The Trickster God knows all manner of ploys and ruses that can be used to counter missile attacks.
Knowledge can be used as a shield against magical attack.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Imrik is prince of the silent realm of Caledor. Despite the decline of the Dragons, Imrik does not waver in his duty.
Caledor is home to Vaul's Anvil, the site of a great temple to the God of Smiths. The work of the priests of Vaul binds the Winds into steel, and forges peerless magical arms and armour.
The age of Dragons is long past, but the pride of Caledorians doth never wane. The fires that once raged upon the peaks now rages within every Caledorian Elf.
Caledorians are renowned for their arrogance. It is however hard to argue their proficiency as elite cavalry.

effects.description:
Charge bonus: +15% for cavalry units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Dragon Princes are the only Elves who would never dip their banners for the Phoenix King, holding to an honour said to have been granted by Caledor himself!

effects.description:
Vigour loss reduction: -50% for Dragon Prince and Dragon units
	(Lord's army)

Physical resistance: 10% for Dragon Prince and Dragon units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +6 for Dragon Prince and Dragon units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: When it is done there shall remain but mounds of ash as far as the eye can see.
The God of Smiths knows the Elves will need fire and fury to survive; his blessings steel them for the darker days ahead.

effects.description:
Upkeep: -5% for Dragon Princes units
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +5 for Dragon Princes units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: It is not the Dragon you should fear…

effects.description: Attacks cause "Flammable" effect, reducing fire resistance

skillTree.localised_description: The sword is the axis of the world and its power is absolute.
Panic and fear are things that happen to others.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against Dark Elves
Weapon strength: +15% when fighting against Greenskins, Skaven, Dark Elves, Beastmen, Warriors of Chaos, Daemons of Chaos and Norsca

skillTree.localised_description: Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
What the enemy cannot see, it cannot hit. What the enemy cannot see, it cannot survive.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.

skillTree.localised_description: Turning an untrained bunch of regular citizens into effective fighting units requires a special kind of talent, and oodles of patience.

skillTree.localised_description: Missile combat isn't always about attacking; knowing how to defend also pays dividends.

skillTree.localised_description: Years of experience in mounted combat has started to pay off; this one is always in command of both their force and its steeds.

skillTree.localised_description: Being present at the very forefront of the assault, on many occasions, prepares one for future engagements of a similar nature.

skillTree.localised_description: Knowing that it is the rare plan that survives contact with the enemy, yet being prepared for all eventualities, raises this one above mere planners.

skillTree.localised_description: Like a wall of the hardest stone imaginable - such is their ability to withstand attack.

skillTree.localised_description: Speed, agility and control - all must be mastered if your crushing tide is to break perfectly upon enemy shores.

skillTree.localised_description: The very centre of the fire always burns the hottest.

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This Lord expects utter obedience from the smallfolk, and has little time for insurrections or petty revolts.
“Underlying most arguments against the free market is a lack of belief in freedom itself.”
The Lords rule, the peasants toil. Nothing has changed in over a thousand years.
This warrior has been ambushed previously and got themselves and many of their compatriots away safely. Such things make one naturally suspicious.
Someone has to ensure the numbers and quality of recruits remain high.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
The ancient Asur arts teach one how to heal as well as how to harm.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Far removed from the petty squabbles of other races, many High Elves are able to devote themselves to learning, magic and the arts.
This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

factionEffects.localised_description: The mountain realm of Caledor once echoed with the cries of Dragons. That time will come again.

effects.description: Dragon Taming: Seek out the secrets of mighty Dragons or defeat them for their allegiance
Invocation of Eldrazor: Improves and grants experience to Dragon Princes, Lords and Heroes
Greater Invocation of Vaul: Additional bonuses for Dragon units
Recruitment duration: -1 turn for Dragon and Dragon Prince units

items.colour_text: Donned by the masters of the House of Caledor, this ensorcelled armour has endured over four thousand years of battles.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Imrik is the last of the line of Caledor the Dragontamer, and shares his lineage's martial excellence and affinity for Dragonkind.

effects.description:
Draconic Resilience: Immune to Mountain and Desert attrition
	(Lord's army)

Upkeep: -25% for Dragons and Dragon Princes
	(Lord's army)
